publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2214 Pauline McNeill: Cycling—That the Parliament congratulates Greater Glasgow Health Board for its initiative in distributing the Glasgow Cycling Map to patients of general practitioners and hopes that this initiative will encourage more Glaswegians to adopt a healthier lifestyle by cycling and contribute to easing traffic congestion in the city.
S1M-2214 Cycling (lodged on 12 September 2001) Trish Godman*

S1M-2214 Pauline McNeill: Cycling—That the Parliament congratulates Greater Glasgow Health Board for its initiative in distributing the Glasgow Cycling Map to patients of general practitioners and hopes that this initiative will encourage more Glaswegians to adopt a healthier lifestyle by cycling and contribute to easing traffic congestion in the city. Supported by: Trish Godman
S1M-2214 Cycling (lodged on 12 September 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Irene Oldfather*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2214 Cycling (lodged on 12 September 2001) Margaret Jamieson*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*

S1M-2214 Pauline McNeill: Cycling-That the Parliament congratulates Greater Glasgow Health Board for its initiative in distributing the Glasgow Cycling Map to patients of general practitioners and hopes that this initiative will encourage more Glaswegians to adopt a healthier lifestyle by cycling and contribute to easing traffic congestion in the city. Supported by: Trish Godman, Tommy Sheridan, Irene Oldfather, Donald Gorrie, Margaret Jamieson, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Elaine Smith*
S1M-2214 Cycling (lodged on 12 September 2001) David Mundell*
S1M-2214 Cycling (lodged on 12 September 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-2214 Pauline McNeill: Cycling-That the Parliament congratulates Greater Glasgow Health Board for its initiative in distributing the Glasgow Cycling Map to patients of general practitioners and hopes that this initiative will encourage more Glaswegians to adopt a healthier lifestyle by cycling and contribute to easing traffic congestion in the city. Supported by: Trish Godman, Tommy Sheridan, Irene Oldfather, Donald Gorrie, Margaret Jamieson, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Elaine Smith, David Mundell, Nora Radcliffe
